wikipedia_page.main: James McMillan Simpson (29 October 1908 – 15 March 1972) was a Scottish footballer who played as a centre half. He spent most of his club career with Rangers, winning ten major honours, and made 14 appearances for the Scotland national team.

response: Jimmy Simpson was a Rangers captain in the 1930s, while his son Ronnie Simpson was Celtic's European Cup-winning goalkeeper in 1967.
James, Jim, or Jimmy Simpson may refer to:
* Jimmy Simpson (American football) (1897–1979), blocking back in the National Football League
* Jimmy Simpson (racing driver) (born 1992), American racing driver
* Jimmy Simpson (North Carolinian racing driver), American racing driver
Simpson's father Jimmy Simpson also played for Scotland, and enjoyed notable success as a centre-half for Rangers and Dundee United in the 1930s.
